result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Letter to the defendant dated 11/03/2022 re: Court appointed Atty Jeanne Zamzow. Defendant is to pay $100 per month commencing 11/30/2022 for court appointed attorney fees.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Jeanne Zamzow)
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Jeanne Zamzow)

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant JAMES C SCOTT in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the paperwork for court appointed counsel. Court questions defendant regarding retainer fees. Statement by defendant. Court questions defendant if he could pay $100 per month if counsel was appointed. Defendant states he would be able to pay $100 a month toward a court appointed attorney. Court will appoint an attorney for the defendant orders first payment to commence November 30, 2022. Court informs the defendant to contact the clerk of court's office in 30 days if he hasn't heard anything regarding court appointed counsel.
Petition for Appointment of Attorney

1:13 PM Defendant James C. Scott in court, in custody and via video. Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement and finds probable cause. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with CB., her daughter or her residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Court sets for Initial Appearance on July 26, 2022 at 9:30 AM. Further statement by the court, if defendant is still in custody, court will re-address bond.

Court adjourned at 1:15 PM
